page.title: 17LOCAL CUSTOMS
page.content: May Fayre: This custom was revived about five years ago in Elham. It takes place in The Square,where there are gaily decorated stalls selling a variety of things. Local children dance around the May-Pole and perform sword-dancing. A very old custom that has been in existance for hundreds of years,is the Elham Bread Charity. A Jonas Warly born in Elham in 1640 left the sum of Â£50, in his will, to provide bread for six poor widows of Elham. In 1984 the children of Elham school dressed as poor widows and re-enacted the bread charity.They went to the church and after the service received bread from the vicar, Mr. Pitt. Lyminge sometimes has a Fun Day with games, competitions and races.
